item.title: Python Lists
item.description: Python Lists Learn to store, access, and manipulate data in lists: the first step toward efficiently working with huge amounts of data. What are lists? A list is a collection which is ordered and changeable. In Python lists are written with square brackets. Create a list myList = ["apple", "banana", "orange"] # Assigning an integer value Accessing List Items Accessing a Range of List Items Change Item Values Copying a List myList = ["apple", "banana", "cherry"] newList = myList.
